title: How to record a Zoom meeting - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on your position at the Zoom meeting. If you are the host starting the meeting from the Zoom app, then you can simply press the Record button. If you’re an attendee, you need to get permission from the host after that you can record the meeting. However, even you have the right to record meetings there are still device limits. What worse is that many third-party recorders are unable to capture Zoom audio during recording extremely for Mac users, which is a headache for me. Fortunately, I’ve solved this problem by using RecMaster which is really efficient and workable. Hope this answer helpful for you.

Locally on your machine. If you’re the host, press the Record button. If you’re an attendee, request permission from the host, they’ll need to go to the attendees list find your name, select allow record, and then you press record. Remember to stop the recording when you’re finished and allow 5–10 minutes per hour for the file to finish compiling, at which time you should get a Popup window giving you access to it.
